page.title: 05 Village School in Wilby
page.content: The village school is over 150 years old & stands next to the church in the centre of the village. Although the building is very old the three class- rooms are bright and attractively decorated with displays of children's work. { Last year the school was modernised and given indoor toilets,a new cloakroom & a small library.} It does not yet have a school hall,but the pupils have games lessons in a nearby playing field. There are about 60 pupils in the school, aged between 7 & 11. They are divided into 3 classes- infants(aged 4-7),lower juniors (8-9) and upper juniors (10-11). They have religious services three times a week in the church. They enjoy country dancing, science,physical education and maths. The school does not have all the facilities of the large town schools.
